PatientMatching.TEXT:
Record date: 2079-01-14
PICH 9 89 James Street, Suite 9 GREENWOOD, NORA Lucerne, KY 66922 60005814 (838) 627-3027 01/14/79
CHIEF COMPLAINT: Ms. Greenwood comes in to urgent care clinic for hives after taking Keflex.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS: She is a 47-year-old woman with chronic hydradenitis suppurativa since the age of 18 in her left axilla and her groin. She has been to the emergency room multiple times for purulent drainage around her groin. She has been given multiple courses of antibiotics including Keflex and dicloxacillin. She is planning to have her disease surgically managed in the next few months. She most recently presented to the emergency room on January 7, 2079 with swelling and drainage of her hydradenitis in her groin. She was given a prescription of Keflex. Shortly after taking the first tablet, she developed itching in the hands, face, and legs and as well as hives. She denied any shortness of breath, difficulty breathing or loss of consciousness. She called the emergency room and was instructed to stop taking Keflex as this was most likely an allergic reaction. So now, she is here for follow up from that. She said shortly after stopping antibiotic her symptoms of hives and itchiness have improved very quickly. She is still complaining of purulent drainage around her groin.
PAST MEDICAL HISTORY: Diabetes.
MEDICATIONS: Glucotrol, Percocet as needed for pain.
ALLERGIES: She is allergic to erythromycin and now Keflex. She gets hives from both.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION: Her left axilla looks dry. Her bilateral groins looks red, swollen tender with some serous as well as some purulent drainage. There is no fluctuance that I could feel.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN: Worsening of her hydradenitis. Given the recent allergy to Keflex, we will obviously need to take a different antibiotic. She has been on dicloxacillin in the past with good result. Despite the 15% cross allergy of dicloxacillin compared to Keflex, I think dicloxacillin is a good choice for now. If this does not work, I think one should consider clindamycin for treatment. I will go ahead and give her 14 days worth of dicloxacillin and I instructing her to notify M.D. if she develops any allergic reaction to this medicine. I also gave her 60 tablets of Percocet as well as renewed her renewed her prescription of Glucotrol XL 2.5 mg a day. She should see her PCP in two weeks.
______________________________ Byron Pham, M.D.
Dictated By: Byron Pham
eScription document:9-3042267 EMSSten Tel
DD: 01/14/79 DT: 01/15/79 DV: 01/14/79
**************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2080-03-24
PICH CLINIC VISIT
PT: Nora Greenwood
Date of Visit: 3/24/80
Contact information: 715-007-3511
Id/cc: 48F with PMH of type II DM, hyperlipidemia, obesity, hidradenitis suppurativa, and new diagnosis of fibromyalgia presenting to PICH for follow-up visit re: 1) DM; 2) HTN; 3) hidradenitis suppurativa 4) fibromyalgia/joint pain.
HPI: Interval hx to be reviewed by each issue.
1) DM: Most recent HgbA1c on 12/31/79: 7.1 (down from 8.2). Nora reports fasting BS in the 140-150 and pre-dinner BS ~low l00's, but does not always check her FS on a regular basis. Noticed that her FS were running much high (>200) when she was taking the elavil for her fibromyalgia. She stopped the elavil bc of these elevated FS. Continues to take Glucotrol XL 2.5mg qd. Denies any episodes of hypoglycemia, but aware of possible symptoms and knows to keep candy with her at all times. Saw nutrition on 6/5/79 and feels that her diet has improved since this session. Continues to be quite active, walking a lot at her job (RN) and at home.
2) HTN: Continues to take lisinopril 20mg qd; BP slightly elevated at last visit at 144/68. Plan to repeat BP check today and if still elevated to increase lisinopril. Denies chest pain, SOB, DOE, LE edema, pnd, orthopnea, recent visual changes, palpitations, or headaches. Has been shoveling snow on a regular basis without sob or chest pain.
3) hidradenitis suppurativa: Nora recently completed 14day course of levaquin for a flare of her hs. In past, treated with diclox and augmentin; however, nora felt that both became less effective with time. Also treated with Bactrim which was d/c'd 2/2 stomach upset. Feels that acute inflammation is better, but still with baseline, fairly severe inflammation, discharge, and pain. Had been seen by general surgery in the past who felt that she needed to be seen by plastics. Was scheduled to see plastics in consultation, but was told that she had to pay 200.00 for visit even though she was free care and could not afford this. Continues to use clindamycin topical gel. Denies fever, chills, night sweats, or n/v.
4) FIBROMYALGIA/JOINT PAINS: Nora was recently seen in urgent care on 2/13/80 with c/o diffuse joint pains and myalgias x 2 weeks. Urgent care w/u included a negative ana, RF, and normal parvovirus IGM level, but IgG was 7.79% (normal less than 1.1). Seen by Dr. Marshall in Rheum who did not feel that she had a "bona fide synovitis" but considered ddx including fibromyalgia and inflammatory arthritis. Further work-up included a negative anti-ccp, normal EST, and a negative ASLO. He started her on elavil to improve her sleep, but nora stopped 2/2 elevated bs. Does feel that improved sleep significantly improves her symptoms.
Problems
Type 2 diabetes
Hyperlipidemia
h/o childhood asthma
H/O pyelonephritis
FH ovarian cancer : mother, grandmother, and sister
smoker
Hypertension
Obesity
Medications
Gluctrol XL 2.5 MG PO QD , Take 1 tablet a day
Miconazole CREAM 2% TOPICAL (MICONAZOLE NITRATE 2%) 1 APPLICATION (2% CREAM(GM) ) TOP TID
Nystatin POWDER TOPICAL TOP BID x 21 days, please apply twice a day to affected areas
Clindamycin 1% GEL TOPICAL TOP BID x 21 days, please apply to affected areas twice a day
Percocet (OXYCODONE+APAP) 1 TAB (5-325MG TABLET ) PO Q4H PRN pain x 30 days, do not drive ot operate heavy machinery while on med as can make you drowsy
Lisinopril 20 MG (40MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days
Zocor (SIMVASTATIN) 20 MG (40MG TABLET take 1) PO QHS x 30 days, if you develop muscle pain or weakness, stop the drug immediately and call your doctor.
Allergies
Erythromycins - Hives,
PE: 218lbs 140/80 80 12
GENERAL: overweight female; appears relatively comfortable at rest, but uncomfortable getting on examining table
HEENT: anicteric, EOMI, PERRL, mmm, thyroid nonpalable
CHEST: CTA-B with good air movement
COR: rrr, S1S2, no m/r/g
ABD: obese, soft, NTND, +BS,
EXT: no edema
DERM: L>>R groin with significant scar tissue and swelling with overlying erythema, decreased drainage compared to last visit, although still significant tenderness to light touch; Left axilla with decreased erythema and drainage, although still w significant scar tissue, swelling, and mild drainage.
A/P: 48F with PMH of type II DM, hyperlipidemia, hidradenitis suppurativa, and new diagnosis of fibromyalgia; a/p to be discussed by each specific issue:
1) DM: Fairly well-controlled type II DM with HgbA1c of 7.1; will continue to aim for <7.
----re-checking HgbA1c today; consider increasing Glucotrol XL from 2.5 to 5mg pnd result, goal <7%.
----continue ASA 81mg qd
----Encouraged continued weight loss; asked Nora to keep food/calorie log to review at next visit
----Re-checking u/a, urine microalb/crt today; ordered last visit, but no results listed.
----Increasing lisinopril from 20mg to 40mg for DM BP goal of <130/80
----Confirm results of optho exam at next visit
----perform DM foot exam at next visit (today denies numbness, paresthesias, or loss of sensation); discussed importance of good foot care and cautious nail clipping
----Given elevated CRP (9.0) and LDL just at goal (96), will increase Zocor from 20mg to 40mg qhs
2) HTN: still w BP above DM goal of <130/80 (140/80)
----Increased lisinopril to 40mg qd
----re-checking chem.7 in 7-10d with lisinopril dose increase
3) hidradenitis suppurativa:
----Will re-contact gen surgery re: their advice (attempt to locate note from visit)
----will also contact plastics to discuss coverage for a procedure that is clearly not cosmetic
----concerned about possible resistance to different abx, but need to treat until more definitive surgical treatment; (wrote script for levo for recurrent inflammation; told Nora that she had to call me to let me know if she needs to use it, but concerned bc last time she was unable to get to PICH until inflammation quite severe)
4) family history of ovarian cancer: strong family history of ovarian cancer (sister, mother, and maternal GM all died from ovarian cancer); previously scheduled to see Dr. Crowley at MTCI on 2/12/80, but pt never received appt letter bc address changed.
----re-scheduled appt with high risk ovarian cancer clinic at the MTCI
5) tobacco cessation: stressed the importance of tobacco cessation to Nora for her heart, cancer risk, pulmonary health, and overall health. She expressed sincere interest in quitting smoking today.
---Will refer to Otha Rush for smoking cessation education
---Mentioned nicotine patches, gum, etc, but Nora felt that she wanted to try to stop without anything for now; will consider these options, if struggling.
6) FIBROMYALGIA/ JOINT PAINS:
----will f/u with rheum Dr. Marshall
7) ? Seizures: discussed "d j vu" sensation that last for minutes and then resolves similar to prior seizures with NP; never mentioned to me; will need to f/u symptoms and neurology appointment at next visit.
8) HCM:
----PAP SMEAR: Pt overdue for pap; once again asked to defer given severe pain 2/2 HS; will continue to offer.
----MAMMOGRAM: Scheduled on several occasions, but never obtained; re-scheduling today.
----LIPIDS: 12/31/79: TCHOL: 183; TRIG: 183; HDL: 50; LDL:96
----Continue to screen for DV and safety level: negative today.
Pt to RTC in 3 mos or sooner as needed.
Pt was presented to and plan discussed with attg, Dr. Ula Lovett.
_____________________________________________
Gina Kevin Irons, M.D.
**************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2081-03-17
PICH CLINIC VISIT PT: Nora Greenwood Date of Visit: 3/17/81 ID/CC: 49F with type II DM, HTN, obesity, hidranitis suppurativa, panic attacks, and fibromyalgia presenting to PICH for f/u visit re: 1) DM, 2) hidrantis suppurative; 3) STD testing; 4) left shoulder pain and to sign up for narcotics log. HPI: Interval hx to be reviewed by specific issue. 1) DM: Most recent HgbA1c 2/02/81: 7.4% (previously 6.9) and urine microalb/crt: 62.8. 2/81 chem 7 wnl (na: 137, k: 4.1, BUN/CRT: 15/0.7), GLU: 186. AM FS: 109-160; 2 hour post prandial 114-115. ~ 2 episodes per month where she feels lightheaded, shaky and has to eat; has not checked FS at time of episodes; resolve with PO intake. Describes frequently missing meals; not eating breakfast. Continues to describe increased activity level. 2) Hidranitis suppurativa: Referred to general surgeon Dr. Iyer at last visit. Nora saw Dr. Iyer on 3/02/81 who felt that given the broad extent of the left axillary involvement, she would require extensive debridement and excision, and likely flap rotation coverage. He, therefore, referred her to plastic surgery. Feels that she needs abx again bc of increasing drainage and erythema. Cipro has been most helpful recently. Previously cultured and negative for MRSA. Today, denies fever, chills, ns, lightheadedness, increasing pain. 3) STD testing: Nora recently reported that her ex husband had told her that he had HCV while they were together but never told her. 11/80 HCV ab negative. Completed further STD testing at last visit and HbsAg, HBsAb, TA-IGG, and HIV were negative. Still have not been able to check GC and Chlamydia bc Nora feels she can not undergo pelvic exam given HS in groin area. Denies any vaginal discharge. Not currently sexually active. 4) Shoulder/Arm pain: See note from 2/02/81 for full hx details. Had MRI scheduled for 2/9/81 but unable to go through 2/2 claustrophobia. Rescheduled for open MRI on 2/28/81 which she was able to complete. Have not yet received fax of results. 5) Pain management/ Narcotics log: Because of pain 2/2 severe HS and now L shoulder, Nora has been taking percocet 5/325 q 4 hours. Reviewed policy for narcotics log. Reviewed risks and benefits of narcotic use, including addiction. Describes regular BM s and no problems with constipation in spite of daily narcotics. Problems Type 2 diabetes Hyperlipidemia h/o childhood asthma H/O pyelonephritis smoker Hypertension Obesity H/O hidradenitis suppuritiva FH Ovarian cancer Comments: mother, grandmother, and sister Medications Miconazole CREAM 2% TOPICAL (MICONAZOLE NITRATE 2%) 1 APPLICATION (2% CREAM(GM) ) TOP TID Nystatin POWDER TOPICAL TOP BID x 21 days, please apply twice a day to affected areas Bactrim DS (TRIMETHOPRIM /SULFAMETHOXAZOLE DOUBLE STRENGTH) 1 TAB PO QD x 30 days Augmentin 875/125 (AMOXICILLIN/CLAV.ACID 875/125) 875 MG (875-125MG TABLET ) PO BID x 14 days Metformin 1000 MG (500MG TABLET take 2) PO BID x 30 days, start with 500mg 1 tab 2x per day; call to discuss increase in 1 wk Hydrochlorothiazide 25 MG (25MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days Nizoral (KETOCONAZOLE) 2 CREAM (2% CREAM(GM) ) TOP BID , Apply to affected areas twice a day. Zocor (SIMVASTATIN) 80 MG (80MG TABLET take 1) PO QHS x 30 days, if you develop muscle pain or weakness, stop the drug immediately and call your doctor. Glucotrol XL (GLIPIZIDE XL) 2.5 MG (2.5MG TAB SR OSM take 1) PO QD Keflex (CEPHALEXIN) 500MG TABLET take 1 Tablet(s) PO QID x 14 days Levaquin (LEVOFLOXACIN) 500 MG (500MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 14 days Cipro (CIPROFLOXACIN) 500 MG (500MG TABLET take 1) PO BID x 14 days Clindamycin 1% GEL TOPICAL TOP BID x 21 days, please apply to affected areas twice a day Phisohex (HEXACHLOROPHENE 3%) 5 ML TOP QD x 30 days Lisinopril 40 MG (40MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days Percocet (OXYCODONE+APAP) 5-325MG TABLET PO q4h PRN pain x 30 days, do not drive ot operate heavy machinery while on med as can make you drowsy Ativan (LORAZEPAM) 0.5 MG (0.5MG TABLET take 1) PO BID PRN anxiety/panic , take one tablet twice daily as needed for panic attacks Allergies Erythromycins - Hives, PE: Vital Signs BP 164/64, P 82, Wt 216 lb General: obese F, appearing uncomfortable w movement of shoulder HEENT: anicteric, mmm, no JVD PULM: CTAB with good air movement COR: rrr, nlS1S2, no m/r/g ABD: obese, soft, NTND, +BS, no HSM appreciated EXT: no LE edema, L shoulder w restricted ROM 2/2 pain; + increased erythema and mild drainage from L axilla A/P: 49F with type II DM, HTN, obesity, hidranitis suppurativa, panic attacks, and fibromyalgia; a/p to be discussed by specific issue. 1) DM: Most recent HgbA1c slightly above goal of <7 (7.4) and increased from prior HgbA1c 6.9. Suspect increased HgbA1c reflects recent cessation of metformin which Nora was not able to tolerate. Per her report, fasting AM FS appears most elevated, although random BG checked at last was 186. Asked Nora to keep a log of her FS, checking fasting, 2 hour post-prandials, and qhs FS on alternating days. ----increasing Glucotrol XL 2.5 mg qd to 5mg qd and suggested taking at night given elevated fasting FS, skipped breakfast but larger dinner, and daytime episodes of presumed hypoglycemia. ----once again reviewed the importance of regular, small meals given glucotrol; discussed considering switch to short-acting glucotrol Nora s slightly irregular food intake to avoid hypoglycemic episodes. Will consider switch at next visit and with review of FS log. ----Asked nora to check FS during episodes of shakiness; will need to monitor closely given recent start of BB and concern that it may mask sx s. Discussed this w Nora and once again emphasized importance of regular meals on glucotrol. ----continue ASA 81mg qd, lisinopril 40mg qd ----2/81 urine microalb/crt: 62.8, above goal of <30 and likely due to persistently elevated BP. Adding additional blood pressure agent today (toprol XL) and will re-check malb/crt once BP under better control. 2/81 BUN/CRT: 15/0.7. ----will perform DM foot exam at next visit. Nora denies any numbness or tingling of extremities at this time. ----BP still not at DM goal of <130/80; adding Toprol Xl 25mg qd to HCTZ 25 qd and Lisinopril 40 qd ----11/80 (NON-FASTING): TCHOL: 189; HDL: 48, TRIG: 154, LDL: 110; on Simvastatin 80mg qhs. LDL slightly above DM goal of <100, but Nora has since attempted to increase exercise and eat low fat, low cholesterol diet. Rechecking lipid panel today. ----OPTHO: will need to confirm appt at f/u visit 2) Hidranitis suppurativa: ----will confirm referral to plastics and schedule if necessary ----prescribing course of cipro given e/o inflammation (less than previous flares) on exam today. 3) STD testing: Recent rpr, HIV, HBC, and HCV neg. Still not able to test for GC/Chlamydia, but no sx s at this time to suggest infection. Will continue to offer, but again Nora declined given significant groin HS. ----recommended HBV vaccination and gave Nora green slip4) Left Shoulder/Arm pain: Suspect multifactorial 2/2 possible rotator cuff injury, biceps tendonitis, and adhesive capsilitis. Offered steroid inject at last visit, but Nora declined and continues to decline. ----will call about MRI results and consider treatment pnd results5) Pain control/Narcotics log: Given increased use of short-acting percocet, started long-acting MS contin 15mg BID and encouraged use of percocet for break-through pain. No trouble w constipation at this time, but warned Nora of increased risk given daily use of narcotics and encouraged hydration and increased fiber intake. Also reviewed Narcotic log contract and conditions. Nora is aware of conditions and rules as well as risks/benefits of chronic narcotic treatment. She agreed to drug testing today as well as all conditions described in contract. ----checking urine drug test today (Nora affirmed use of valium and percocet at 6:00am) 6) HTN: Still above goal of <130/80 and with e/o microablumin on 2/81 urine test on HCTZ 25mg qd and lisinopril 40mg qd. Will add toprol XL 25mg qd today. Discussed possible side-effects including fatigue, mood changes, etc. ----scheduled f/u with NP in 10d to re-check BP and HR; consider increasing dose if still not at goal and HR tolerates. Will also assess for development of any SE at that visit. ----TO DO: review sleep apnea ROS at next visit and will need to re-visit smoking cessation 7) Elevated AP: Suspect 2/2 fatty liver (elevated GGT confirming GI source and RUQ w e/o fatty liver) and asx at this time; continue RF modification (wt loss, strict lipid control). Will re-check in 6 mos (~7-8/81). Consider GI eval if significant elevation or symptoms. 8) Panic attacks: continue tx through psych (CBT and valium prn). ----confirm f/u appt w psych at next visit 9) +FH of ovarian cancer (mother, sister, maternal GM died of ovarian CA). Has had multiple previously scheduled appts to see high risk clinic at MTCI. Again offered to re-schedule for her, but Nora said that she had the number and was going to reschedule. Asked her to call me with date to confirm. 10) TOBACCO USE: Nora reported quitting at last visit but today smelled of smoke. Confirmed that she had restarted, ~ 4 cig/day. Will need to discuss further at next visit and once again review crucial nature of smoking cessation for her. 11) HCM ----11/3/80 LIPID PANEL: (NON-FASTING): TCHOL: 189; HDL: 48, TRIG: 154, LDL: 110; rechecking today. ----PAP SMEAR: Pt overdue for pap; once again asked to defer given severe pain 2/2 HS; will continue to offer; discussed my concern regarding continual deferral of pap and the risks that this posses. Nora states that she understands risks but feels that exam would be impossible given pain. ----MAMMOGRAM: Scheduled on several occasions, but never obtained bc of pain. Nora still feels that examine would be impossible given HS. Will continue to discuss and work to get treatment for her HS. Expressed my concern regarding continual deferral of mammogram and risk for cancer. Nora states that she understands risk but simply feels that it would be impossible given level of pain. I offered to give her pain medications but she still does not feel that she could undergo this test yet. Will continue to discuss with her. ----DV SCREEN: negative today; ex-husband again in prison. Previous h/o abuse. Will continue to screen. ----Ca and VIt D: gave her PICH pt education handout regarding daily requirements ----SEATBELTS: + use ----OP: review OP RF at next visit TO DO: ----will need to review previous OPTHO findings; Nora mentioned that her opthomologist mentioned something I should know ; asked her to get phone number so I can call him to find out what she is referring to. Pt to RTC in 1 mos or sooner if needed. Will call Nora with results of MRI. Pt was presented to and plan discussed with attg, Dr. Xian. _____________________________________________ Gina Kevin Irons, M.D.
**************************************************************************************************** Record date: 2081-10-07
Ms. Greenwood is a 50yo F with DM, HTN, hidradenitis, hyperlipidemia and obesity who presents for routine follow-up. Since her last visit, she has been to the Windsor Hospital where she was started on "sea kelp" lotion for hidradenitis and was told to bathe in salt water and keep the affected areas moist. No longer taking levofloxacin. She is encouraged about this new treatment. These doctors recommended losing 50 lbs, which could help her condition as well. Because of this, she has been to see the nutritionist today and is eager to lose 40lb.
Diabetes: as her sugars have been high, she self increased metformin to BID. Has not noticed any side effects. Would like her sugars checked today.
Social Stressors: her husband will be released from jail in November. She intends to move prior to his release. Still involved with psychiatry and passageways. Uses ativan up to 4 times a day for anxiety. Had her meds confiscated by security at Chariton airport as her PICH last name does not match her drivers license.
Trauma: attacked by her cat 5 days ago on her left wrist--using topical antibiotics obtained at Montgomery Infirmary ED.
SHx: volunteering for Computer Sciences Corporation and enjoying the work. Smoking has decreased to 4 per day. Home phone # 249-007-9762
Medications Colace (DOCUSATE Sodium) 100 MG (100MG TABLET take 1) PO TID Oxycontin (OXYCODONE Controlled Release) 10 MG (10MG TAB.SR 12H take 1) PO BID x 10 days LISINOPRIL 40 MG (40MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days Zocor (SIMVASTATIN) 80 MG (80MG TABLET take 1) PO QHS x 30 days, if you develop muscle pain or weakness, stop the drug immediately and call your doctor. Glucotrol Xl (GLIPIZIDE Xl) 5 MG (5MG TAB SR OSM take 1) PO QD METFORMIN 500 MG (500MG TABLET take 1) PO QD -->BID HYDROCHLOROTHIAZIDE 25 MG (25MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days Toprol Xl (METOPROLOL Succinate Extended Release) 50 MG (50MG TAB.SR 24H take 1) PO QD x 30 days Celexa (CITALOPRAM) 20 MG (20MG TABLET take 1) PO QD x 30 days, take 1/2 tab x 4 days and then take one tablet daily Percocet 5 Mg/325 Mg (OXYCODONE 5 Mg/acetaminophen 325 Mg) 1-2 TAB PO Q4-6H x 11 days Clindamycin 1% Gel 1 APPLICATION (1% GEL ) TOP BID x 21 days, please apply to affected areas twice a day OXYCODONE 5 MG (5MG TABLET take 1) PO Q6H PRN pain , to be alternated with percocet to minimize tylenol dose Ativan (LORAZEPAM) 0.5 MG (0.5MG TABLET take 1) PO Q6H PRN anxiety/panic , take one tablet up to four times daily as needed for panic attacks
Exam Vital Signs BP 142/62, P 72, Wt 227 lb AGE 50y6.2m Gen: cheerful, only slightly tearful when discussing husband and frustration with pain, desire to avoid pelvic or breast exam Lungs: CTA bilaterally CV: RRR without murmurs Abd: soft, nontender Axilla: + hidradenitis of left axilla without erythema or pustules at current time
Plan 1. Hidradenitis--Still attempting to control medically. Refilled clindamycin gel with increased supply. Avoiding oral antibiotics unless large pustules. Awaiting records from Windsor Hospital. Will start on narcotics log for percocet/oxycodone. Reevaluate supply in 3 months and consider cutting down to 90 pills of each at that time.
2. Diabetes--checking HgA1C today given reported elevated sugars. Continue metformin and glipizide for now. Will call if she needs to increase metformin dose.
3. HTN--still high, but improved. On HCTZ, lisinopril 40 and toprol 50. Will monitor with weight loss efforts.
4. Psychiatry--labile emotions, has psychiatry and passageway supports in place. Disability paper work in process.
5. HCM--currently refusing pap and mammogram, as it will be "too painful". Will consider it again in 3 months. Note: known family h/o ovarian/breast ca. Will continue to provide support and encourage screening examinations.
_____________________________________________ Brandy F. Tate, M.D., Ph.D.
